quetzalcoatl.name: quetzalcoatl
quetzalcoatl.description:
The main backbone of the Quetzalcoatl front-end. This code must be used in
conjunction with the WebSocket server interfacing with the Kinect for Windows
API found at /server, and the Kinect for Windows V2.
quetzalcoatl.author: Leart Albert Ulaj

text.name: text
text.description:
Provides the text class. The text block is located on the left-hand side of
the UI, and displays texts, lists, quotes, code, or equations that annotate
content in the main block. This class contains helper functions for manipulating
the text content in various ways.

cursor.name: cursor
cursor.description: Provides the cursor class. The cursor is displayed on-screen as a pair of circles

gestures.name: gestures
gestures.description:
Provides the gesture class. Gestures are detected by the Kinect API running
on the WebSocket server. Handles to detected gestures (in the form of handStates)
are passed to the front-end via a JSON object. This class contains the logic
that is executed when the gestures are received.

websocket.name: websocket
websocket.description:
Provides the websocket class. Data coming from the Kinect is received by
listening on a WebSocket server running either locally or at an exposed address.
This class provides core functions for connecting to and disconnecting from
the server, as well as helper methods for parsing incoming data.

classitems.description:
Bootstrap.js by @fat & @mdo
plugins: bootstrap-transition.js, bootstrap-modal.js, bootstrap-dropdown.js, bootstrap-scrollspy.js, bootstrap-tab.js, bootstrap-tooltip.js, bootstrap-popover.js, bootstrap-affix.js, bootstrap-alert.js, bootstrap-button.js, bootstrap-collapse.js, bootstrap-carousel.js, bootstrap-typeahead.js
Copyright 2012 Twitter, Inc.
http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.txt
A handle to the text block.
classitems.name: textContainer

classitems.description: A handle to the items in the text block.
classitems.name: textList

classitems.description:
Highlights a block of text in the side block. If the element passed in as input
is not in the side block, this function does nothing. If the element is already
highlighted, it remains highlighted.
classitems.name: highlight

params.name: elem
params.description: An object corresponding to a DOM element

classitems.description:
Removes highlights from all blocks of text in the side block. If nothing is
currently highlighted, this function does nothing.
classitems.name: unHighlight

classitems.description: A handle to the canvas element that draws the cursor
classitems.name: c

classitems.description: The radius of the cursor circle when the hand is in an "open" state
classitems.name: open_radius

classitems.description: The radius of the cursor circle when the hand is in a "closed" state.
classitems.name: grab_radius

classitems.description: The radius of the cursor circle when the hand is in a "pointing/lasso" state.
classitems.name: point_radius

classitems.description:
The color of the left hand cursor circle. This color is taken from the
5-color palette from the Solarized color scheme.
classitems.name: leftColor

classitems.description:
The color of the right hand cursor circle. This color is taken from the
5-color palette from the Solarized color scheme.
classitems.name: rightColor

classitems.description: The dimensions of the user's screen, which we call the screen viewport.
classitems.name: scoord

classitems.description:
Rounds a number such that it is a multiple of the provided number. This function
comes in handy for stabilizing cursor jitter (by rounding the mapped coordinates).
classitems.name: stabilizer

params.name: factor
params.description: A number which represents a multiple to which x will be rounded.

classitems.description:
A tracker for the zoom state of the main block.
True if the block is zoomed in and false otherwise
classitems.name: zoomState

classitems.description:
A tracker for the highlight state of the side block.
True if the block is highlighted and false otherwise
classitems.name: highlightState

classitems.description:
A tracker for the collapse state of the side block.
True if the block is collapsed and false otherwise
classitems.name: collapseState

classitems.description: A handle to the "Previous" button in the main block.
classitems.name: prevButton

classitems.description: A handle to the "Next" button in the main block.
classitems.name: nextButton

classitems.description: A handle to the main block itself.
classitems.name: container

classitems.description: Mimics a mouse click on the DOM object below the cursor circle
classitems.name: click

params.name: arr
params.description: An array containing x and y coordinates in the screen viewport

classitems.description:
Performs a "pull" gesture on the DOM object below the cursor circle.
A pull gesture is a negative change in the z-axis made with a closed hand
- Pulling on the main block zooms into the item under the cursor
- Pulling on the side block highlights the text under the cursor and fades all others
classitems.name: pull

params.name: arr
params.description: An array containing x and y coordinates in the screen viewport

classitems.description:
Performs a "push" gesture on the DOM object below the cursor circle.
A push gesture is a positive change in the z-axis made with a closed hand
- Pushing anywhere on the main block zooms out to the panel view
- Pushing anywhere on the side block un-highlights any highlighted text
classitems.name: pull

params.name: arr
params.description: An array containing x and y coordinates in the screen viewport

classitems.description:
Performs a "swipe left" gesture on the DOM object below the cursor circle.
A swipe left gesture is a negative change in the x-axis made with an open hand
- Swiping left on the main block advances to the next item if the block is currently
  in a zoomed state. If the block is not zoomed, swiping does nothing.
- Swiping left on the side block collapses the side block if the block is currently
  expanded. If the block is not expanded, swiping does nothing.
classitems.name: swipeLeft

params.name: arr
params.description: An array containing x and y coordinates in the screen viewport

classitems.description:
Performs a "swipe right" gesture on the DOM object below the cursor circle.
A swipe left gesture is a positive change in the x-axis made with an open hand
- Swiping right on the main block backtracks to the previous item if the block is currently
  in a zoomed state. If the block is not zoomed, swiping does nothing.
- Swiping right on the side block expands the side block if the block is currently
  collapsed. If the block is not collapsed, swiping does nothing.
classitems.name: swipeRight

params.name: arr
params.description: An array containing x and y coordinates in the screen viewport

classitems.description:
Performs a "swipe up" gesture on the DOM object below the cursor circle.
A swipe up gesture is a positive change in the y-axis made with an open hand
- Swiping up on the main block scrolls downwards
- Swiping up on the side block highlights the next section of text under the cursor
classitems.name: swipeUp

params.name: arr
params.description: An array containing x and y coordinates in the screen viewport

classitems.description:
Performs a "swipe down" gesture on the DOM object below the cursor circle.
A swipe up gesture is a negative change in the y-axis made with an open hand
- Swiping up on the main block scrolls upwards
- Swiping up on the side block highlights the previous section of text under the cursor
classitems.name: swipeDown

params.name: arr
params.description: An array containing x and y coordinates in the screen viewport

classitems.description:
Bootstrap.js by @fat & @mdo
